DataElement.preferredDefinition: The time crofelemer was taken after noon.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: An oligomeric proanthocyanidin extracted from the latex produced by the tree Croton lechleri (Euphorbiaceae), with antidiarrheal, and potential antiviral and antimicrobial activities. Upon oral administration, crofelemer acts locally within the gastrointestinal (GI) tract by inhibiting both the cystic fibrosis transmembrane conductance regulator (CFTR) chloride ion (Cl-) channel and the calcium-activated Cl- channel (CaCC) expressed on the luminal surface of enterocytes. This inhibits the secretion of chloride ions into the intestinal lumen and prevents high volume water loss. By normalizing Cl- and water balance in the intestines, crofelemer relieves secretory diarrhea._The time period between noon and sunset._Having been accepted for some purpose; ingested as a medication.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: An oligomeric proanthocyanidin extracted from the latex produced by the tree Croton lechleri (Euphorbiaceae), with antidiarrheal, and potential antiviral and antimicrobial activities. Upon oral administration, crofelemer acts locally within the gastrointestinal (GI) tract by inhibiting both the cystic fibrosis transmembrane conductance regulator (CFTR) chloride ion (Cl-) channel and the calcium-activated Cl- channel (CaCC) expressed on the luminal surface of enterocytes. This inhibits the secretion of chloride ions into the intestinal lumen and prevents high volume water loss. By normalizing Cl- and water balance in the intestines, crofelemer relieves secretory diarrhea.

Concepts.definition: An oligomeric proanthocyanidin extracted from the latex produced by the tree Croton lechleri (Euphorbiaceae), with antidiarrheal, and potential antiviral and antimicrobial activities. Upon oral administration, crofelemer acts locally within the gastrointestinal (GI) tract by inhibiting both the cystic fibrosis transmembrane conductance regulator (CFTR) chloride ion (Cl-) channel and the calcium-activated Cl- channel (CaCC) expressed on the luminal surface of enterocytes. This inhibits the secretion of chloride ions into the intestinal lumen and prevents high volume water loss. By normalizing Cl- and water balance in the intestines, crofelemer relieves secretory diarrhea.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The continuum of experience in which events pass from the future through the present to the past.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Time is the continuum of experience in which events pass from the future through the present to the past.  It may also refer to a specific point in this continuum or to the interval separating two points.  It is generally measured in minutes, days, months, or years.

Concepts.definition: The continuum of experience in which events pass from the future through the present to the past.
